text: <@U3R58JBC4> PutRawState enables you to write any byte array stream where you can put any custom data
<@U31A496G2> Yes you can, convert any POJO and use ByteString.copyFrom
<@U0YNFB22X> so they are basically the same right? thanks for your answer!
putState only takes in String. NP
<@U0YNFB22X> - thanks. but does that enable me to query these data structures using chaincode?
Could JAVA chaincode called by rest API? as there are only command line(CLI)  example in official document <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/JAVAChaincode/>
You can use rest API, but that is being deprecated, I suggest you use sdk instead
<@U31A496G2> Yes, you can, of course you will have to deserialize it accordingly

<@U0YNFB22X> thx~but how to deploy the chaincode by using sdk? as the CLI likes  "peer chaincode deploy -l java -p /opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/examples/chaincode/java/SimpleSample -c '{"Args": ["init", "a","100", "b", "200"]}'"
